1081044217990795266.text:
working conjecture implicit in my work:
-> it is possible to claim that game has an equilibrium around a resource allocation even if you don't know the agents objective functions if your designs build on convex optimization and/or Lyapunov function based equilibrium proofs.

1081041738364407808.text:
-> conservation constraints in mechanism design are the best tools for encoding provable strategy agnostic system properties
-> heterogeneity in agents objective functions allow for non-zero sum games whose trajectories look like solutions to resource allocation optimization

1081039956221382657.text:
-> moving to discrete time replaces integrals with sums making the methods more implementable
-> crypto systems have native discrete time in two scales: block-height and transaction order
-> properties derived from mechanisms without assumption on behavior hold for all strategies

1081038492921081857.text:
my practical notes:
-> dynamic programming covered but heuristic strategies are more common in observed economic games
-> theory presented in continuous time but real data is often discrete time variants of diff-eq
-> generalizes to multiplayer games more easily than you think

1020631035275603968.text:
Physical Information = matter and energy. 

Thanks to natural conservation laws, very existence of matter or energy serves as a zero-knowledge proof that it has a valid history.

1020628198437138432.text: The digital world just got real.

1020628145127297024.text: Conservation Laws in nature are generalized versions of the no double spend condition.

1020627860275572736.text: Arguably, the only thing that truly distinguishes physical information from digital information is the shared nature of our reality. If I throw you a baseball, you have it and I don't.

1020627412575563776.text: The value of information provenance, and thus blockchain enabled software systems of all kinds, extends beyond currency to the very nature of digital information.

1020627132396056576.text: Solutions which hide this information provenance for privacy reasons are valid because they do not eliminate the provenance they simple provide zero-knowledge-proof of a valid history.

1020626714894925829.text: The decentralized network provides the service of information provenance but one might argue that it is the information provenance itself regarding these *currencies* that makes it easy for us to trust them as media of exchange or stores of value.

1020626166003138561.text: My claim to a BTC or an ETH comes with information provenance because those assets can be traced back to their minting via their respective blockchain ledgers.

1020625909072777217.text: Information Provenance -- the chain of evidence accounting for all mutations back to the origin of a claim.

1020306405969022976.text:
Step 1) Distributed Ledgers provide information provenance. 
Step 2) Literally everything changes.
